summary: the astroviruses belong to the Astroviridae family, consisting of non-enveloped viruses whose plus-sense, single-stranded polyadenylated genome of approximately 7 kb is organized in three open reading frames (ORFs) ORF1a, ORF1b and ORF2 [1], [2], preceded and followed, respectively, by the 5′ and 3′ untranslated regions (UTRs) of 80 to 100 nucleo several heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoproteins (hnRNPs), La autoantigen (La), poly (A) binding protein (PABP), poly-r (C)-binding proteins (PCBP1/2) also known as hnRNPE2, cellular protein eukaryotic elongation factor 1A (eEF1A) and Nucleolin, might be involved in viral replication [10]–[17]. immunoprecipitation assays identified PTB in the 57/60-kDa bands. recombinant PTB was cross-linked to 3′UTR probes containing intact helix I. recombinant PTB was localized mainly in the cytoplasm of HAstV-8 infected cells. extracts were stored at 80°C until use. proteins were quantitated with the Bradford assay kit (Sigma) PCR reactions were done in presence of 10 M of DNA duplex for full-length 3′UTR, HI/mPTB, and mPTB. the PCR mix contained 10 M of each oligonucleotide, 10 mM dNTPs, 25 mM MgCl2 and 2 U of Dream Taq polymerase. the same conditions were used for the unrelated RNA (REST) control template. amplification of the expected products was monitored on agarose gel. each 32P-labeled RNA probe (1105 cpm) was incubated at 4°C in crosslink binding buffer (50 mM HEPES pH 7.9, 80 mM MgCl2, 0.5 mM DTT, 124 mM KCl, 20% Glycerol) RNA-protein complexes were irradiated with UV light (254 nm) for 20 min on ice. a nontarget siScrambled (160 nM) was used as a negative control. the concentrations used for siPTB were 2.5 M and 5 M. samples were harvested for RNA isolation, western-blotting and virus titer determination. cDNA was quantified using the GloMax Multi Detection System. 500 ng of cDNA was used by the PCR step in a final reaction volume of 20 l. reaction was performed three times for each (FITC)-conjugated donkey anti-goat IgG at 175 dilution. cells were visualized under lasser confocal microscopes LSM710 (Carl Zeiss) and Olym CaCo2 cells were infected with HAstV-8 strain Yuc 8. proteins were quantitated with the Bradford assay kit (Sigma) extracts were stored at 80°C until use. DNA duplexes were generated using the respective primer sets HAstV-8-F/HAstV-8-R (spanning nt 6674 to 6759 from strains Yuc8; accession AF260508), mPTB-fwd/mPTB-rev (UCUU PTB binding site within nt 6700 to 6704 changed to CGAA), and HI/mPTB-fwd (TAATACGACTCACTATA PCR mix contained 10 M of each oligonucleotide, 10 mM dNTPs (Roche), 25 mM MgCl2 and 2 U of Dream Taq polymerase in the appropriate buffer. incubation times and temperatures were: 2 min at 94°C, followed by 35 cycles of 1 min at 94°C denaturation, annealing for 1 min at 52°C and extension 1 min at 72°C. polyclonal antibodies to hnRNP1 and goat-IgG anti-rabbit-HRP (Zymed) non-related antibodies were preincubated for 15 min in the binding reaction. UV crosslinking and immunoprecipitation assays were carried out using protocols previously described [15] with modification. siRNA-mediated knockdown of PTB, qRT-PCR and viral titration. RNA structures of the viral 3′UTR of all HAstVs were predicted with the MFold software. RNA binding of cellular proteins to the 3′UTR RNA sequences seems to be non-specific, since it was competed both by homologous and heterologous RNAs without PTB/hnRNP1 binding sites. complex CI and specific complex CII are indicated. g of S10 from uninfected (lane 2) or HAstV-8-infected CaCo2 cells were separated by SDS-10%PAGE and detected by autoradiography. western blotting with monoclonal anti-Actin and polyclonal anti-Lamin A antibodies detected seven proteins of 35, 40, 45, 50, 52, 57/60 and 75 kDa from both cell extracts. complex CIII is slightly enriched in infected cells suggesting that PTB/hnRNP1 is present in the complexes recruited in the 3′UTR RNA. in steady state cells, PTB/hnRNP1 functions in mRNA transport and stability as well as IRES-mediated translation. confocal microscopy of PTB/hnRNP1 shows same nuclear-cytoplasm shuttling of PTB/hnRNP1. phosphorylation at Ser-16 modulates nucleo-cytoplasmic distribution. HAstV-8 3′UTR (A), mPTB (B), HI (C) and HI/mPTB (D) were incubated with 0.50 and 1 g of recombinant His-PTB or 1 g of BSA (C) free probes are shown in lanes 1 and F, respectively. nRNP1 knockdown expression was observed in the nuclei of transfected CaCo2 cells with the scrambled siRNA. in contrast, PTB was absent from the nuclei of siPTB treated cells. a 77% reduction of PTB protein expression was achieved with 2.5 M of siPTB. cells resulted in a 42% reduction of viral production (7106 ffu/ml) with siPTB compared with siScrambled-transfected cells (1.8107 ffu/ml) this result is consistent with the knockdown of host cell proteases. astroviral RNA negative strand synthesis appears 12 hours post-infection. nsP1b signal intensity was quantified by densitometry. signal intensity is expressed as percent of expression reduction with respect to actin signals. RNA level of HAstV-8 was determined by qRT-PCR. HAstV-8 3′UTR structure is arranged in two helixes (I and II) connected through a linker. split the 3′UTR facilitated comparisons between strains. helix II nucleotide variations were found. cellular proteins bound to the 3′UTR in positive-strand RNA viruses play important roles in assembling the viral RNA replication complex. among them are PTB, EF-1, La, Nucleolin, Sam68, PABP, PCBP1/2 and TIA-1/TIAR [38]–[40], [15], [41]–[43], [17]. the complete 3′UTR and mPTB version consisting of nt 6,674 to 6,759, H1 and HI/mPTB shorts versions consisting of nt 6,674 to 6,706. the versions HI/mPTB and mPTB have a UCUU PTB binding site within nt 6700 to 6704 changed to CGAA. ed HAstV-8 3′UTR (nt 6674 to 6759) was UV cross-linked to uninfected and infected cells. seven proteins of 35, 40, 45, 50, 52, 57/60 and 75 kDa from both cell extracts were bound to the probe. stronger signals of individual proteins of infected cell extracts were observed. PTB/hnRNP1 is maintained in the cytoplasm upon cellular stress, such as viral infections. in steady state cells, PTB/hnRNP1 also functions in mRNA transport and stability. western blot and co-localization assays were carried out with anti-hnRNP1 and anti-PTB antibodies. the redistribution of PTB/hnRNP1 is due to phosphorylation at Ser-16. phosphorylation modulates the nucleo-cytoplasmic distribution. nsp1a/4 phosphorylation capacitates nsp1a/4-RNA polymerase interaction for the establishment a productive infection by HAstV-8. the HAstV-8 infected positive cells were labeled with anti-HAstV CQFG sera (red) nuclei are shown by DAPI (blue) staining. the images of cell were acquired with a confocal lasser scanning microscope.
